citations.narrative:
Opened packages of bedding used for Orangutan enclosures were stored on the floor in a storage unit. While the facility
associated the storage unit configuration as a leakproof entity, the current setup does not contain the bedding supplies in
a leakproof container with a tightly fitting to lid and was stored adjacent to other items in the same area.
Storing bedding in containers with lids lessens the substrates’ exposure to contamination, vermin, and spoilage when
confined in its own container. The supplies must be stored off the floor and away from the walls, to allow cleaning
underneath and around the supplies. Open bedding supplies not in use must be kept in leakproof containers with tightly
fitting lids to prevent spoilage and contamination. Substances that are toxic to nonhuman primates, but are required for
normal husbandry practices, must not be stored in food storage and preparation areas unless kept in cabinets.
Correct by August 4, 2023.

The refrigerator used for the anteater’s perishable food supplies had an expired container of yogurt maintained in its
inventory. In addition, an opened container of baby food used for the giraffe barn had been used, but was not refrigerated
after opening. Though the facility provided labeled instructions directing all staff to date and refrigerate all opened baby
food items, one opened jar had been stored in the food bin.
Inopportune storage of food items can result in illness and compromise of health to the animals if consumed. Supplies of
food shall be stored in facilities which adequately protect such supplies against deterioration, molding, or contamination
by vermin. Refrigeration shall be provided for supplies of perishable food.
The facility corrected during the inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.75(e) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Opened packages of bedding used for Orangutan enclosures were stored on the floor in a storage unit. While the facility 
associated the storage unit configuration as a leakproof entity, the current setup does not contain the bedding supplies in 
a leakproof container with a tightly fitting to lid and was stored adjacent to other items in the same area. 
Storing bedding in containers with lids lessens the substrates’ exposure to contamination, vermin, and spoilage when 
confined in its own container. The supplies must be stored off the floor and away from the walls, to allow cleaning 
underneath and around the supplies. Open bedding supplies not in use must be kept in leakproof containers with tightly 
fitting lids to prevent spoilage and contamination. Substances that are toxic to nonhuman primates, but are required for 
normal husbandry practices, must not be stored in food storage and preparation areas unless kept in cabinets. 
Correct by August 4, 2023. 
3.125(c) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The refrigerator used for the anteater’s perishable food supplies had an expired container of yogurt maintained in its 
inventory. In addition, an opened container of baby food used for the giraffe barn had been used, but was not refrigerated 
after opening. Though the facility provided labeled instructions directing all staff to date and refrigerate all opened baby 
food items, one opened jar had been stored in the food bin. 
Inopportune storage of food items can result in illness and compromise of health to the animals if consumed. Supplies of 
food shall be stored in facilities which adequately protect such supplies against deterioration, molding, or contamination 
by vermin. Refrigeration shall be provided for supplies of perishable food. 
The facility corrected during the inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives. 
 
 n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
